p: Last-instar larvae of C. perspectalis were collected from unsprayed Buxus sempervirens trees located in a private garden in Staré Hodějovice (South Bohemia, Czech Republic, 49° N) and maintained in net cages at a room temperature with 16L:8D photoperiod for a few days before they were used in bioassays. Young twigs of untreated box trees collected in the vicinity of the Biology Centre, České Budějovice were provided as food and replaced with fresh ones when needed.
